caption: At this time of crisis for the Amazon, I support the people of Brazil working to save their natural and cultural heritage. They are an amazing, moving and humbling example of the commitment and passion needed to save the environment. The future of these irreplaceable ecosystems is at stake and I am proud to stand with the groups protecting them. While worthy of support, we did not fund the organizations targeted. I remain committed to supporting the Brazilian indigenous communities, local governments, scientists, educators and general public who are working tirelessly to secure the Amazon for the future of all Brazilians.

The amount of land affected by an oil spill in North Dakota is almost 10 times larger than initially reported, officials say. TC Energy, the company that owns the Keystone 1 Pipeline, shut it down on October 29 after discovering more than 383,000 gallons of oil had leaked from the pipe into surrounding wetlands. Initial reports from TC Energy and and North Dakotaâ€™s Department of Environmental Quality estimated about 2,500 square yards of land were affected â€” now they say itâ€™s more than 23,000 square yards. Fresh hope for the Critically Endangered Cuban Crocodile, as @global_wildlife_conservation joins @TheWCS and Cuban partners to release 10 young captive Cuban Crocodiles into the wild.
For thousands of years, Cuban Crocodiles thrived in the Zapata Swamp, the largest coastal wetland in the Caribbean Islands, but unchecked hunting decimated their numbers to some 3,000 in the wild today.
Not only are these top predators vital for keeping the food chain in check, but they are also important ecosystem engineers that shape and maintain mangrove ecosystems by excavating underwater caves and canals.
Today they are threatened by hunting, habitat destruction, and hybridization with American Crocodiles in areas where the two species have been forced into closer proximity. Losing the Cuban Crocodile would have significant repercussions both ecologically and culturally.
Fortunately, a captive breeding sanctuary was established in Zapata Swamp in 1959, providing an important reservoir for reestablishing the crocodile in the wild. A dedicated team is now working to bring the Cuban Crocodile back from the brink through a program of reintroduction, monitoring, and education.
Follow @global_wildlife_conservation to learn how you can join these efforts.

Photos by @robindmoore

Record-breaking concerns. #environment #sustainability #emissions #energy #renewables

Last May, the @mayorofla, the @countyofla, the State of California, automakers, and other leaders came together with @laincubator to form the Transportation Electrification Partnership, to go further and faster together toward transportation electrification and zero emissions to reduce air pollution and GHGs by the time the world arrives in Los Angeles for the 2028 Olympics.
This year, the partnership has set the most ambitious targets in the nation to move to electric cars and trucks, charging stations, and mode shift to affirm Californiaâ€™s right to set standards for GHG emissions and clean vehicle standards.

The Roadmap v2.0 release marks TEP's transition to develop and pursue policies, incentives, pilots to accelerate progress toward these targets by 2028. Inspired by the Olympics spirit in 1984, TEP wants to show the world that LA--known for traffic, smog, and fast cars--can come together this time to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and air pollution while growing our economy and creating jobs.

Together, letâ€™s clean our air and fight the climate crisis by making the LA area the worldâ€™s leader in zero emissions.

Letâ€™s also encourage other regions to move faster by creating regional collaborations on zero emissions transportation like TEP, whether in California or across the United States.

Follow @laincubator and read more at laincubator.org/roadmap

#Regram #RG @amazonfrontlines:
In a powerful photo-essay, two young indigenous photographers from the Ecuadorian Amazon take us on a journey to investigate and experience the reality of the Amazon fires which ravaged hundreds of thousands of acres of primary rainforest across Bolivia, Brazil and Paraguay.
On this journey through Bolivia's Amazon, they not only witness forests turned to ashes, dead animals, dried rivers and the expansion of the agricultural frontier, but also meet the affected communities and join the growing resistance movements against the powers that allow for this crisis to happen. Link in @amazonfrontlines bio.
#AmazonFires #AmazonRainforest #ActForAmazonia #indigenousstorytelling #Ecuador #Bolivia #indigenousyouth

#Regram #RG @turtlesurvival:
Winter Smuggling and Confiscations Begin in Northern India. .
From @shaisingh.india , @turtlesurvivalindia .
Last week 600 Softshell Turtles representing four species were confiscated at Pratapgarh junction by General Railway Police and UP Forest Department. Five people were detained with the consignment. All of the turtles were released in the Sai River after a primary health assessment. .
The Turtle Survival Alliance works year round with enforcement agencies to curb the loss of Indiaâ€™s turtles to illegal trade and return them to the wild. Winter is the season of smuggling and correspondingly, confiscations increase. .
Photos: Pratapgarh Division of UP Forest Department
